sen.j: 檜皮姫（ひわだひめ、寛喜2年（1230年） - 宝治元年（1247年）5月13日 (旧暦)）は、鎌倉時代中期の北条氏一門の女性。
sen.e: Hiwadahime (1230-May 13, 1247) was a woman who was a member of the Hojo family during the middle of the Kamakura period.
Hiwadahime (1230-May 13, 1247) was a woman who was a member of the Hojo family during the middle of the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 北条時氏の娘で、鎌倉幕府5代将軍藤原頼嗣の正室。
sen.e: She was the daughter of Tokiuji HOJO and the legal wife of the fifth shogun of the Kamakura bakufu, FUJIWARA no Yoritsugu.
She was the daughter of Tokiuji HOJO and the legal wife of the fifth shogun of the Kamakura bakufu, FUJIWARA no Yoritsugu.

sen.j: 檜皮姫の祖父である3代執権北条泰時の死後、19歳の兄北条経時が跡を継いだ。
sen.e: When Hiwadahime's grandfather who was the third regent, Yasutoki HOJO died, her brother Tsunetoki HOJO took his position at the age of 19.

sen.j: その後、将軍藤原頼経を中心とした反得宗勢力と執権北条氏との対立が起こる。
sen.e: The anti-Tokuso family headed by the shogun FUJIWARA no Yoritsune later had a conflict with the regent from the Hojo family.

sen.j: 経時は将軍頼経を退位させ、頼経の子で6歳の藤原頼嗣を新将軍に立てた。
sen.e: Tsunetoki forced the shogun Yoritsune to abdicate his position and placed Yoritsune's son, FUJIWARA no Yoritsugu as shogun at the age of 6.

sen.j: と、翌年の寛元3年（1245年）7月26日、16歳の妹檜皮姫を7歳の新将軍頼嗣の正室として嫁がせた。
sen.e: On July 26, 1245, Tsunetoki married his sister Hiwadahime to the new shogun Yoritsugu as his legal wife when she was seven years old.

sen.j: 凶日であるとして反対する周囲を押し切っての輿入れだった。
sen.e: They were married on the black-letter day despite the objections of others.

sen.j: この婚姻成立によって、頼経の正室竹御所の死後に失われた北条氏の将軍家外戚の地位を復活させたのである。
sen.e: After this marriage, the Hojo clan regained the position as the shogun's maternal relatives that had been lost since the death of Yoritsune's legal wife, Take no Gosho.

sen.j: しかし経時は翌年寛元4年（1246年）に死去し、その弟北条時頼が執権職を継いで将軍派との対立が激化した。
sen.e: However, Tsunetoki died in 1246, and the confrontation escalated between the shogun's side and Tsunetoki's brother, Tokiyori HOJO who took over the position of regent.

sen.j: 檜皮姫は病床に伏し、加持祈祷の甲斐なく宝治元年（1247年）5月13日、18歳で死去した。
sen.e: Hiwadahime became sick and died at the age of 18 on May 13, 1247 in spite of an incantation and prayer for her.
